tasks.title: Setup Backend with Node.js, TypeScript, and Express
tasks.description: Initialize the Node.js backend with TypeScript, setting up the basic Express.js server.
tasks.details:
1.  Initialize a new Node.js project with `npm init -y`.
2.  Install required dependencies: `npm install express typescript @types/express @types/node nodemon ts-node fs-extra`.
3.  Configure `tsconfig.json` for TypeScript compilation.
4.  Create `src/index.ts` with a basic Express server setup.
5.  Implement basic middleware for request logging and error handling.
6.  Configure `nodemon` for automatic server restarts on file changes.
7.  Create a `.env` file to store configuration variables.
8.  Set up a basic route to test the server (e.g., `/api/health`).

Recommended versions:
*   express: ^4.18.2
*   typescript: ^5.2.2
*   nodemon: ^3.0.1
*   ts-node: ^10.9.1
*   fs-extra: ^11.1.1
tasks.testStrategy: Send a GET request to the `/api/health` endpoint and verify that the server returns a 200 OK status code with a success message.

subtasks.title: Install Backend Dependencies
subtasks.description: Install necessary npm packages for the backend, including express, cors, dotenv, and any database drivers.
subtasks.details:

tasks.title: Implement Calculator Management API Endpoints
tasks.description: Implement API endpoints for calculator management (CRUD operations) using Express.js.
tasks.details:
1.  Define the data structure for calculator configurations (as provided in the PRD).
2.  Implement the following API endpoints:
    *   `GET /api/calculators`: Retrieve all calculators.
    *   `POST /api/calculators`: Create a new calculator.
    *   `GET /api/calculators/:id`: Retrieve a specific calculator by ID.
    *   `PUT /api/calculators/:id`: Update a calculator.
    *   `DELETE /api/calculators/:id`: Delete a calculator.
3.  Use `fs-extra` to read and write calculator data to JSON files.
4.  Implement error handling for each endpoint (e.g., handling invalid IDs, file read/write errors).
5.  Validate request bodies to ensure data integrity.

Recommended versions:
*   fs-extra: ^11.1.1
tasks.testStrategy: Use tools like `Postman` or `Insomnia` to test each API endpoint. Verify that the endpoints return the correct data and status codes. Test error handling by sending invalid requests.

tasks.title: Integrate Math.js for Formula Calculation
tasks.description: Integrate Math.js into the backend to handle formula parsing, validation, and calculation.
tasks.details:
1.  Install Math.js: `npm install mathjs`.
2.  Create a utility function to parse and validate mathematical formulas using Math.js.
3.  Implement the `/api/calculate` endpoint to accept a formula and variable values.
4.  Use Math.js to evaluate the formula with the provided values.
5.  Return the calculated result as a JSON response.
6.  Implement error handling for invalid formulas and calculation errors.

Recommended versions:
*   mathjs: ^11.11.1
tasks.testStrategy: Send POST requests to the `/api/calculate` endpoint with various formulas and variable values. Verify that the endpoint returns the correct results and handles errors appropriately.

4.  Set up basic routing using `react-router-dom` if needed.

tasks.testStrategy: Run the development server using `npm run dev` and verify that the React application loads correctly in the browser. Check the console for any errors.

tasks.title: Configure Tailwind CSS

tasks.title: Create Formula Editor Component
tasks.description: Create a formula editor component using React Hook Form and Math.js for input, validation, and preview.
tasks.details:
1.  Install React Hook Form: `npm install react-hook-form @hookform/resolvers`.
2.  Create a `FormulaEditor` component with a text input field for entering mathematical formulas.
3.  Use React Hook Form to handle form state and validation.
4.  Integrate Math.js to validate the formula syntax in real-time.
5.  Display error messages for invalid formulas.
6.  Implement a preview feature to show the rendered formula.

Recommended versions:
*   react-hook-form: ^7.45.4
*   @hookform/resolvers: ^3.3.2
tasks.testStrategy: Enter various mathematical formulas into the `FormulaEditor` component and verify that the validation works correctly. Check that error messages are displayed for invalid formulas and that the preview feature shows the rendered formula.

tasks.title: Implement Interactive Calculator Interface
tasks.description: Implement the interactive calculator interface that dynamically generates input fields based on the formula.
tasks.details:
1.  Create a `Calculator` component that receives a formula and a list of variables as props.
2.  Dynamically generate input fields for each variable using React Hook Form.
3.  Support different input types (number, slider, dropdown) based on variable properties.
4.  Use Math.js to calculate the result in real-time as the user enters values.
5.  Display the calculated result.

Recommended versions:
*   react-hook-form: ^7.45.4
tasks.testStrategy: Enter values into the dynamically generated input fields and verify that the calculator calculates the correct result in real-time. Test different input types and ensure that they work as expected.
